metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1311 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: The Apache Xerces-C 3.0.0 to 3.2.3 XML parser contains a use-after-free error triggered during the scanning of external DTDs. This flaw has not been addressed in the maintained version of the library and has no current mitigation other than to disable DTD processing. This can be accomplished via the DOM using a standard parser feature, or via SAX using the XERCES_DISABLE_DTD environment variable.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> upstream hasn't merged any official fix for this issue. RH has pushed a fix for their release that is accepted to be a valid mitigation for the user-after-free, but it is claimed to contain a memory leak. deferred as of 2022-10-24. as of 2023-08-23, upstream hasn't reviewed the proposed fix from the PR. it seems like upstream has not been very active. still deferred.

criterions.comment: xerces-c package in focal is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023-08-23').
